main event: A civilian in Brooklyn, New York observed an elongated, oval-shaped object maneuvering in the sky, resembling a cigar. The object was seen descending and becoming brighter, and then changing color from white to yellow before disappearing.
interesting points: Several witnesses corroborated the observation, and their accounts suggested that the object caused a considerable effect.
The observed object exhibited unusual characteristics for a meteor, including a change in brightness, shape, and color, contradicting typical meteor behavior.
The witness estimated the speed of the object to be 150-200 m.p.h. and its distance from the observer to be approximately 200 yards.
The witness mistook the object for a plane, then a rocket, before realizing it was unlike any aircraft or material seen before.
The witness, a process pipeline engineer, provided educational and professional background information as part of the report.
sighted object: elongated, oval-shaped object maneuvering in the sky
